Research Papers on AI and Technology in Various Domains

Abe Bohan Hou, William Jurayj, Nils Holzenberger, Andrew Blair-Stanek, and Benjamin Van Durme published a paper on machine-generated legal analysis.
The paper is titled "Gaps or Hallucinations? Gazing into Machine-Generated Legal Analysis for Fine-grained Text Evaluations".
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.

Dietrich Trautmann, Natalia Ostapuk, Quentin Grail, Adrian Alan Pol, Guglielmo Bonifazi, Shang Gao, and Martin Gajek published a paper on legal question-answering systems.
The paper is titled "Measuring the Groundedness of Legal Question-Answering Systems".
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.

Chong Zhang and colleagues explored AI in finance with a paper on stock trading.
The paper is titled "When AI Meets Finance (StockAgent): Large Language Model-based Stock Trading in Simulated Real-world Environments".
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.

Ying Nie and colleagues developed a Chinese financial benchmark for large language models.
The paper is titled "CFinBench: A Comprehensive Chinese Financial Benchmark for Large Language Models".
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.

Jillian Ross, Yoon Kim, and Andrew W Lo examined behavioral biases of large language models.
The paper is titled "LLM Economicus? Mapping the Behavioral Biases of LLMs via Utility Theory".
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.

Hui Zhong, Songsheng Chen, and Mian Liang studied gender bias in large language models from an existentialism perspective.
The paper is titled "Gender Bias of LLM in Economics: An Existentialism Perspective".
The paper was published as an arXiv preprint in 2024.
